SEARCH

Package net.jnellis.interleave

package net.jnellis.interleave
A set of implementations that perform interleaving operations on one or more collections. An interleaving operation is an alternating ordering of elements from two positions or from two collections.
See Also:
  • Faro Shuffle
  • Class
    Description
    AbstractInterleaver
    AbstractInterleaver holds some essential boilerplate for converting out-shuffle and folding variants to in-shuffle operations.
    Interleaver
    In place (in-memory) interleave a single collection or two collections, using a Faro Shuffle.
    Interleavers
    A suite of algorithms to perform interleaving of one or two collections, in place, without heap allocation.
    JosephusInterleaver
    Perform a SequenceInterleaver interleave up to the first half and then performs a Josephus_2 Prime cycle on the remaining half.
    PermutationInterleaver
    An implementation of A Simple In-Place Algorithm for In-Shuffle
    RecursiveInterleaver
    An implementation of 'power of 2' based divide and conquer recursive interleaver.
    SequenceInterleaver
    An implementation of an interleaver that uses a sequence generated method to place elements into position.
    Shuffle
    Descriptor to identify types of interleaving shuffle operations on Interleavers.
    ShufflePrimeInterleaver
    Implementation of Shuffle Prime interleaving based on Josephus_2 Primes
    Util
    Some static utility functions used by interleaving algorithms.
